122

Growing gregariously and in clusters (but not fused) on mixed oak/hickory woodland ridge adjacent to large river (Missouri), next to Northern Red Oak, American Hophornbeam, Shagbark Hickory, Black Oak and Eastern Red Cedar trees.

- Pileipellis cracking on larger specimens. 
- Lamellae lightly serrated, bruising orangish-brown when damaged. 
- Stipe lightly bruising orange (with time).

Additional Info
- Taste: Acrid (spicy).
- KOH: bright orange on stipe.
